A large number of network requests in a small span of time can cause the running program to stop. An attacker can send a sequence of requests to trigger this vulnerability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-13530&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13530\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13530&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1143\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;p11-kit_project -- p11-kit&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in p11-kit 0.21.1 through 0.23.21. Multiple integer overflows have been discovered in the array allocations in the p11-kit library and the p11-kit list command, where overflow checks are missing before calling realloc or calloc.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29361&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29361\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29361&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/p11-glue/p11-kit/releases\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/p11-glue/p11-kit/security/advisories/GHSA-q4r3-hm6m-mvc2\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;pega -- pega_platform&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Pega Platform through 8.4.x is affected by Cross Site Scripting (XSS) via the ConnectionID parameter, as demonstrated by a pyActivity=Data-TRACERSettings.pzStartTracerSession request to a PRAuth URI.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-23957&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-23957\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-23957&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://jayaramyalla.medium.com/cross-site-scripting-in-pega-cve-2020-23957-16d1c417da5f\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;pixar -- openusd&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An out of bounds memory corruption vulnerability exists in the way Pixar OpenUSD 20.05 reconstructs paths from binary USD files. A specially crafted malformed file can trigger an out of bounds memory modification which can result in remote code execution. To trigger this vulnerability, victim needs to access an attacker-provided malformed file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-13520&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13520\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13520&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1120\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;pluck-cms -- pluck&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A file upload restriction bypass vulnerability in Pluck CMS before 4.7.13 allows an admin privileged user to gain access in the host through the \"manage files\" functionality, which may result in remote code execution.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29607&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29607\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29607&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/pluck-cms/pluck/issues/96\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;polarisoffice -- polaris_ml_report&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in ML Report Program. There is a stack-based buffer overflow in function sub_41EAF0 at MLReportDeamon.exe. The function will call vsprintf without checking the length of strings in parameters given by attacker. And it finally leads to a stack-based buffer overflow via access to crafted web page. This issue affects: Infraware ML Report 2.19.312.0000.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-7837&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-7837\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-7837&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.boho.or.kr/krcert/secNoticeView.do?bulletin_writing_sequence=35849\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;redhat -- keycloak&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in Keycloak before 13.0.0 where an external identity provider, after successful authentication, redirects to a Keycloak endpoint that accepts multiple invocations with the use of the same \"state\" parameter. This flaw allows a malicious user to perform replay attacks.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-14302&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-14302\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-14302&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1849584\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;redhat -- keycloak&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in Keycloak before 13.0.0, where it is possible to force the server to call out an unverified URL using the OIDC parameter request_uri. This flaw allows an attacker to use this parameter to execute a Server-side request forgery (SSRF) attack.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; The AdvancedScripts HTTP endpoint allows CSRF.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25622&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25622\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25622&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://ernw.de/en/publications.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://insinuator.net/2020/12/security-advisories-for-solarwinds-n-central/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.solarwinds.com/SuccessCenter/s/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;sonatype -- nexus_repository_manager&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Sonatype Nexus Repository Manager 3.x before 3.29.0 allows a user with admin privileges to configure the system to gain access to content outside of NXRM via an XXE vulnerability. Thus, any authenticated user can run the elFinder upload command to achieve remote code execution. NOTE: This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-14&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35235&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35235\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35235&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://blog.nintechnet.com/authenticated-rce-vulnerability-in-wordpress-secure-file-manager-plugin-unpatched/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/secure-file-manager/#developers\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;tibco -- partnerexpress&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The REST API component of TIBCO Software Inc.'s TIBCO PartnerExpress contains a vulnerability that theoretically allows an unauthenticated attacker with network access to obtain an authenticated login URL for the affected system via a REST API. Affected releases are TIBCO Software Inc.'s TIBCO PartnerExpress: version 6.2.0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27147&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27147\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27147&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://www.tibco.com/services/support/advisories\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.tibco.com/support/advisories/2020/12/tibco-security-advisory-december-15-2020-tibco-partnerexpress\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;tiki -- tikiwiki_cms\\/groupware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;TikiWiki 21.2 allows templates to be edited without CSRF protection. This could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack and perform arbitrary actions on an affected system. The vulnerability is due to insufficient CSRF protections for the web-based management interface of the affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of the interface to follow a maliciously crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to perform arbitrary actions on an affected system with the privileges of the user. These action include allowing attackers to submit their own code through an authenticated user resulting in local file Inclusion. If an authenticated user who is able to edit TikiWiki templates visits an malicious website, template code can be edited.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29254&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29254\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29254&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/S1lkys/CVE-2020-29254\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/S1lkys/CVE-2020-29254/blob/main/Tiki-Wiki%2021.2%20by%20Maximilian%20Barz.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://youtu.be/Uc3sRBitu50\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;ua-parser-js_project -- ua-parser-js&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The package ua-parser-js before 0.7.23 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) in multiple regexes (see linked commit for more info).&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-7793&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-7793\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-7793&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/faisalman/ua-parser-js/commit/6d1f26df051ba681463ef109d36c9cf0f7e32b18\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARSBOWERGITHUBFAISALMAN-1050388\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARSNPM-1050387\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-UAPARSERJS-1023599\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;ui -- edgemax_edgepower_24v_firmware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A security issue was found in EdgePower 24V/54V firmware v1.7.0 and earlier where, due to missing CSRF protections, an attacker would have been able to perform unauthorized remote code execution.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-14&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8282&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8282\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8282&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://community.ui.com/releases/Security-advisory-bulletin-016-016/40c1d33d-785e-44d5-8e6c-56a8addef1bc\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;uip_project -- uip&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in uIP 1.0, as used in Contiki 3.0 and other products. When the Urgent flag is set in a TCP packet, and the stack is configured to ignore the urgent data, the stack attempts to use the value of the Urgent pointer bytes to separate the Urgent data from the normal data, by calculating the offset at which the normal data should be present in the global buffer. However, the length of this offset is not checked; therefore, for large values of the Urgent pointer bytes, the data pointer can point to memory that is way beyond the data buffer in uip_process in uip.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-17437&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17437\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17437&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;uip_project -- uip&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The code that processes DNS responses in uIP through 1.0, as used in Contiki and Contiki-NG, does not check whether the number of responses specified in the DNS packet header corresponds to the response data available in the DNS packet, leading to an out-of-bounds read and Denial-of-Service in resolv.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-24334&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24334\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24334&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;uip_project -- uip&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in uIP 1.0, as used in Contiki 3.0 and other products. The code that parses incoming DNS packets does not validate that domain names present in the DNS responses have '\\0' termination. This results in errors when calculating the offset of the pointer that jumps over domain name bytes in DNS response packets when a name lacks this termination, and eventually leads to dereferencing the pointer at an invalid/arbitrary address, within newdata() and parse_name() in resolv.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-17440&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17440\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17440&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;weseek -- growi&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Directory traversal vulnerability in GROWI versions prior to v4.2.3 (v4.2 Series), GROWI versions prior to v4.1.12 (v4.1 Series), and GROWI v3 series and earlier GROWI versions prior to v4.2.3 (v4.2 Series), GROWI versions prior to v4.1.12 (v4.1 Series), and GROWI v3 series and earlier allows remote attackers to alter the data by uploading a specially crafted file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-5683&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-5683\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-5683&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/weseek/growi\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://hub.docker.com/r/weseek/growi/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN94169589/index.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;weseek -- growi&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Improper input validation in GROWI versions prior to v4.2.3 (v4.2 Series), GROWI versions prior to v4.1.12 (v4.1 Series), and GROWI v3 series and earlier GROWI versions prior to v4.2.3 (v4.2 Series), GROWI versions prior to v4.1.12 (v4.1 Series), and GROWI v3 series and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via unspecified vectors.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-5682&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-5682\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-5682&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/weseek/growi\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://hub.docker.com/r/weseek/growi/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN94169589/index.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;westerndigital -- dashboard&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Western Digital Dashboard before 3.2.2.9 allows DLL Hijacking that leads to compromise of the SYSTEM account.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-12&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29654&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29654\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29654&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.westerndigital.com/support/productsecurity/wdc-20011-western-digital-dashboard-privilege-escalation\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;wireshark -- wireshark&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Crash in USB HID protocol dissector and possibly other dissectors in Wireshark 3.4.0 and 3.2.0 to 3.2.8 allows denial of service via packet injection or crafted capture file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26418&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26418\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26418&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cves/-/blob/master/2020/CVE-2020-26418.json\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://gitlab.com/wireshark/wireshark/-/issues/16739\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2020-16.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;wireshark -- wireshark&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Memory leak in RTPS protocol dissector in Wireshark 3.4.0 and 3.2.0 to 3.2.8 allows denial of service via packet injection or crafted capture file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26420&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26420\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26420&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cves/-/blob/master/2020/CVE-2020-26420.json\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://gitlab.com/wireshark/wireshark/-/issues/16994\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2020-18.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;wireshark -- wireshark&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Memory leak in the dissection engine in Wireshark 3.4.0 allows denial of service via packet injection or crafted capture file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26419&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26419\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26419&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cves/-/blob/master/2020/CVE-2020-26419.json\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://gitlab.com/wireshark/wireshark/-/issues/17032\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2020-19.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;wp-ecommerce -- easy_wp_smtp&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The easy-wp-smtp plugin before 1.4.4 for WordPress allows Administrator account takeover, as exploited in the wild in December 2020. If an attacker can list the wp-content/plugins/easy-wp-smtp/ directory, then they can discover a log file (such as #############_debug_log.txt) that contains all password-reset links. The attacker can request a reset of the Administrator password and then use a link found there.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-14&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35234&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35234\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35234&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://blog.nintechnet.com/wordpress-easy-wp-smtp-plugin-fixed-zero-day-vulnerability/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/easy-wp-smtp/#developers\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;x.org -- x_server&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server before 1.20.10. A heap-buffer overflow in XkbSetDeviceInfo may lead to a privilege escalation vulnerability. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25712&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.6&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25712\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25712&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1887276\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2020-December/003066.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. A bounds check common to most operation time functions specific to FIFO event channels depends on the CPU observing consistent state. While the producer side uses appropriately ordered writes, the consumer side isn't protected against re-ordered reads, and may hence end up de-referencing a NULL pointer. Malicious or buggy guest kernels can mount a Denial of Service (DoS) attack affecting the entire system. Only Arm systems may be vulnerable. Whether a system is vulnerable depends on the specific CPU. x86 systems are not vulnerable.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29571&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29571\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29571&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4812\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-359.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. Recording of the per-vCPU control block mapping maintained by Xen and that of pointers into the control block is reversed. The consumer assumes, seeing the former initialized, that the latter are also ready for use. Malicious or buggy guest kernels can mount a Denial of Service (DoS) attack affecting the entire system.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29570&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29570\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29570&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/12/16/4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4812\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-358.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. Some OSes (such as Linux, FreeBSD, and NetBSD) are processing watch events using a single thread. If the events are received faster than the thread is able to handle, they will get queued. As the queue is unbounded, a guest may be able to trigger an OOM in the backend. All systems with a FreeBSD, Linux, or NetBSD (any version) dom0 are vulnerable.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29568&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29568\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29568&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-349.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen 4.6 through 4.14.x. When acting upon a guest XS_RESET_WATCHES request, not all tracking information is freed. A guest can cause unbounded memory usage in oxenstored. This can lead to a system-wide DoS. Only systems using the Ocaml Xenstored implementation are vulnerable. Systems using the C Xenstored implementation are not vulnerable.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29485&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29485\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29485&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4812\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-330.txt\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. When a Xenstore watch fires, the xenstore client that registered the watch will receive a Xenstore message containing the path of the modified Xenstore entry that triggered the watch, and the tag that was specified when registering the watch. Any communication with xenstored is done via Xenstore messages, consisting of a message header and the payload. The payload length is limited to 4096 bytes. Any request to xenstored resulting in a response with a payload longer than 4096 bytes will result in an error. When registering a watch, the payload length limit applies to the combined length of the watched path and the specified tag. Because watches for a specific path are also triggered for all nodes below that path, the payload of a watch event message can be longer than the payload needed to register the watch. A malicious guest that registers a watch using a very large tag (i.e., with a registration operation payload length close to the 4096 byte limit) can cause the generation of watch events with a payload length larger than 4096 bytes, by writing to Xenstore entries below the watched path. This will result in an error condition in xenstored. This error can result in a NULL pointer dereference, leading to a crash of xenstored. A malicious guest administrator can cause xenstored to crash, leading to a denial of service. Following a xenstored crash, domains may continue to run, but management operations will be impossible. Only C xenstored is affected, oxenstored is not affected.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29484&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29484\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29484&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4812\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-324.txt\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. Access rights of Xenstore nodes are per domid. Unfortunately, existing granted access rights are not removed when a domain is being destroyed. This means that a new domain created with the same domid will inherit the access rights to Xenstore nodes from the previous domain(s) with the same domid. Because all Xenstore entries of a guest below /local/domain/&amp;lt;domid&amp;gt; are being deleted by Xen tools when a guest is destroyed, only Xenstore entries of other guests still running are affected. For example, a newly created guest domain might be able to read sensitive information that had belonged to a previously existing guest domain. Both Xenstore implementations (C and Ocaml) are vulnerable.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29481&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.6&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29481\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29481&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/12/16/3\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4812\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-322.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. A guest may access xenstore paths via absolute paths containing a full pathname, or via a relative path, which implicitly includes /local/domain/$DOMID for their own domain id. Management tools must access paths in guests' namespaces, necessarily using absolute paths. oxenstored imposes a pathname limit that is applied solely to the relative or absolute path specified by the client. Therefore, a guest can create paths in its own namespace which are too long for management tools to access. Depending on the toolstack in use, a malicious guest administrator might cause some management tools and debugging operations to fail. For example, a guest administrator can cause \"xenstore-ls -r\" to fail. However, a guest administrator cannot prevent the host administrator from tearing down the domain. All systems using oxenstored are vulnerable. Building and using oxenstored is the default in the upstream Xen distribution, if the Ocaml compiler is available. Systems using C xenstored are not vulnerable.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29482&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29482\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29482&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4812\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-323.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. Xenstored and guests communicate via a shared memory page using a specific protocol. When a guest violates this protocol, xenstored will drop the connection to that guest. Unfortunately, this is done by just removing the guest from xenstored's internal management, resulting in the same actions as if the guest had been destroyed, including sending an @releaseDomain event. @releaseDomain events do not say that the guest has been removed. All watchers of this event must look at the states of all guests to find the guest that has been removed. When an @releaseDomain is generated due to a domain xenstored protocol violation, because the guest is still running, the watchers will not react. Later, when the guest is actually destroyed, xenstored will no longer have it stored in its internal data base, so no further @releaseDomain event will be sent. This can lead to a zombie domain; memory mappings of that guest's memory will not be removed, due to the missing event. This zombie domain will be cleaned up only after another domain is destroyed, as that will trigger another @releaseDomain event. If the device model of the guest that violated the Xenstore protocol is running in a stub-domain, a use-after-free case could happen in xenstored, after having removed the guest from its internal data base, possibly resulting in a crash of xenstored. A malicious guest can block resources of the host for a period after its own death. Guests with a stub domain device model can eventually crash xenstored, resulting in a more serious denial of service (the prevention of any further domain management operations). Only the C variant of Xenstore is affected; the Ocaml variant is not affected. Only HVM guests with a stubdom device model can cause a serious DoS.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29483&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29483\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29483&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4812\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-325.txt\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. When they require assistance from the device model, x86 HVM guests must be temporarily de-scheduled. The device model will signal Xen when it has completed its operation, via an event channel, so that the relevant vCPU is rescheduled. If the device model were to signal Xen without having actually completed the operation, the de-schedule / re-schedule cycle would repeat. If, in addition, Xen is resignalled very quickly, the re-schedule may occur before the de-schedule was fully complete, triggering a shortcut. This potentially repeating process uses ordinary recursive function calls, and thus could result in a stack overflow. A malicious or buggy stubdomain serving a HVM guest can cause Xen to crash, resulting in a Denial of Service (DoS) to the entire host. Only x86 systems are affected. Arm systems are not affected. Only x86 stubdomains serving HVM guests can exploit the vulnerability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29566&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29566\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29566&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4812\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-348.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. Nodes in xenstore have an ownership. In oxenstored, a owner could give a node away. However, node ownership has quota implications. Any guest can run another guest out of quota, or create an unbounded number of nodes owned by dom0, thus running xenstored out of memory A malicious guest administrator can cause a denial of service against a specific guest or against the whole host. All systems using oxenstored are vulnerable. Building and using oxenstored is the default in the upstream Xen distribution, if the Ocaml compiler is available. Systems using C xenstored are not vulnerable.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29486&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29486\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29486&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4812\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;DEBIAN&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-352.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xen -- xen&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Xen 4.14.x. When moving IRQs between CPUs to distribute the load of IRQ handling, IRQ vectors are dynamically allocated and de-allocated on the relevant CPUs. De-allocation has to happen when certain constraints are met. If these conditions are not met when first checked, the checking CPU may send an interrupt to itself, in the expectation that this IRQ will be delivered only after the condition preventing the cleanup has cleared. For two specific IRQ vectors, this expectation was violated, resulting in a continuous stream of self-interrupts, which renders the CPU effectively unusable. A domain with a passed through PCI device can cause lockup of a physical CPU, resulting in a Denial of Service (DoS) to the entire host. Only x86 systems are vulnerable. Arm systems are not vulnerable. Only guests with physical PCI devices passed through to them can exploit the vulnerability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29567&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29567\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29567&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://xenbits.xenproject.org/xsa/advisory-356.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xstream_project -- xstream&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;XStream is a Java library to serialize objects to XML and back again. In XStream before version 1.4.15, a Server-Side Forgery Request vulnerability can be activated when unmarshalling. The vulnerability may allow a remote attacker to request data from internal resources that are not publicly available only by manipulating the processed input stream. If you rely on XStream's default blacklist of the Security Framework, you will have to use at least version 1.4.15. The reported vulnerability does not exist if running Java 15 or higher. No user is affected who followed the recommendation to setup XStream's Security Framework with a whitelist! Anyone relying on XStream's default blacklist can immediately switch to a whilelist for the allowed types to avoid the vulnerability. Users of XStream 1.4.14 or below who still want to use XStream default blacklist can use a workaround described in more detailed in the referenced advisories.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26258&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26258\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26258&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/x-stream/xstream/security/advisories/GHSA-4cch-wxpw-8p28\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r97993e3d78e1f5389b7b172ba9f308440830ce5f051ee62714a0aa34@%3Ccommits.struts.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://x-stream.github.io/CVE-2020-26258.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;xstream_project -- xstream&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;XStream is a Java library to serialize objects to XML and back again. In XStream before version 1.4.15, is vulnerable to an Arbitrary File Deletion on the local host when unmarshalling. The vulnerability may allow a remote attacker to delete arbitrary know files on the host as log as the executing process has sufficient rights only by manipulating the processed input stream. If you rely on XStream's default blacklist of the Security Framework, you will have to use at least version 1.4.15. The reported vulnerability does not exist running Java 15 or higher. No user is affected, who followed the recommendation to setup XStream's Security Framework with a whitelist! Anyone relying on XStream's default blacklist can immediately switch to a whilelist for the allowed types to avoid the vulnerability. Users of XStream 1.4.14 or below who still want to use XStream default blacklist can use a workaround described in more detailed in the referenced advisories.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26259&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26259\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26259&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/x-stream/xstream/security/advisories/GHSA-jfvx-7wrx-43fh\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r97993e3d78e1f5389b7b172ba9f308440830ce5f051ee62714a0aa34@%3Ccommits.struts.apache.org%3E\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MLIST&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://x-stream.github.io/CVE-2020-26259.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;zyxel -- p1302-t10_v3_firmware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Insecure direct object reference vulnerability in Zyxels P1302-T10 v3 with firmware version 2.00(ABBX.3) and earlier allows attackers to gain privileges and access certain admin pages.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-14&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-20183&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-20183\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-20183&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.zyxel.com/us/en/support/P1302-T10D-v3-modem-insecure-direct-object-reference-vulnerability.shtml\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t&lt;/tbody&gt;\n&lt;/table&gt;\n&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov#top\"&gt;Back to top&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;a name=\"low\"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n\n&lt;div id=\"low_v\"&gt;\n&lt;h2 id=\"low_v_title\"&gt;Low Vulnerabilities&lt;/h2&gt;\n\n&lt;table align=\"center\" border=\"1\" style=\"table-layout: fixed; width: 100%;\" summary=\"Low Vulnerabilities\"&gt;\n\t&lt;thead&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"col\" style=\"width:24%;\"&gt;Primary&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\tVendor -- Product&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:44%;\"&gt;Description&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:10%;\"&gt;Published&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:8%;\"&gt;CVSS Score&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;th scope=\"col\" style=\"width:14%;\"&gt;Source &amp;amp; Patch Info&lt;/th&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t&lt;/thead&gt;\n\t&lt;tbody&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;adremsoft -- netcrunch&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;AdRem NetCrunch 10.6.0.4587 has a stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the NetCrunch web client. The user's input data is not properly encoded when being echoed back to the user. This data can be interpreted as executable code by the browser and allows an attacker to execute JavaScript code in the context of the user's browser if the victim opens or searches for a node whose \"Display Name\" contains an XSS payload.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2019-14478&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2019-14478\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2019-14478&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://compass-security.com/fileadmin/Research/Advisories/2020-12_CSNC-2019-013_AdRem_NetCrunch_Cross-Site_Scripting_XSS.txt\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.adremsoft.com/support/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;adremsoft -- netcrunch&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;AdRem NetCrunch 10.6.0.4587 has Improper Credential Storage since the internal user database is readable by low-privileged users and passwords in the database are weakly encoded or encrypted.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-28930&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28930\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28930&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://blog.bssi.fr/multiple-vulnerabilities-within-epson-eps-tse-server-8/#vulnerability-2\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;ethereum -- go_ethereum&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Go Ethereum, or \"Geth\", is the official Golang implementation of the Ethereum protocol. In Geth from version 1.9.4 and before version 1.9.20 a consensus-vulnerability could cause a chain split, where vulnerable versions refuse to accept the canonical chain. The fix was included in the Paragade release version 1.9.20. No individual workaround patches have been made -- all users are recommended to upgrade to a newer version.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26265&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26265\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26265&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/releases/tag/v1.9.20\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/security/advisories/GHSA-xw37-57qp-9mm4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gitlab -- gitlab&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Information disclosure in Advanced Search component of GitLab EE starting from 8.4 results in exposure of search terms via Rails logs. We recommend upgrading past commit b1d120a2c7d7446d2cc58d517e20a1b184b82200&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8942&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8942\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8942&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/google/asylo/commit/b1d120a2c7d7446d2cc58d517e20a1b184b82200\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;google -- asylo&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An arbitrary memory read vulnerability in Asylo versions up to 0.6.0 allows an untrusted attacker to make a call to enc_untrusted_inet_pton using an attacker controlled klinux_addr_buffer parameter. The parameter size is unchecked allowing the attacker to read memory locations outside of the intended buffer size including memory addresses within the secure enclave. We recommend upgrading past commit 8fed5e334131abaf9c5e17307642fbf6ce4a57ec&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8941&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8941\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8941&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/google/asylo/commit/8fed5e334131abaf9c5e17307642fbf6ce4a57ec\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;google -- asylo&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An arbitrary memory read vulnerability in Asylo versions up to 0.6.0 allows an untrusted attacker to make a call to enc_untrusted_recvmsg using an attacker controlled result parameter. The parameter size is unchecked allowing the attacker to read memory locations outside of the intended buffer size including memory addresses within the secure enclave. We recommend upgrading or past commit fa6485c5d16a7355eab047d4a44345a73bc9131e&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8940&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8940\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8940&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/google/asylo/commit/fa6485c5d16a7355eab047d4a44345a73bc9131e\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;google -- asylo&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An out of bounds read on the enc_untrusted_inet_ntop function allows an attack to extend the result size that is used by memcpy() to read memory from within the enclave heap. We recommend upgrading past commit 6ff3b77ffe110a33a2f93848a6333f33616f02c4&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8939&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8939\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8939&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/google/asylo/commit/6ff3b77ffe110a33a2f93848a6333f33616f02c4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;google -- asylo&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An arbitrary memory overwrite vulnerability in Asylo versions up to 0.6.0 allows an attacker to make a host call to UntrustedCall. UntrustedCall failed to validate the buffer range within sgx_params and allowed the host to return a pointer that was an address within the enclave memory. This allowed an attacker to read memory values from within the enclave.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-15&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-8936&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-8936\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-8936&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/google/asylo/commit/83036fd841d33baa7e039f842d131aa7881fdcc2\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;google -- asylo&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An arbitrary memory overwrite vulnerability in Asylo versions up to 0.6.0 allows an attacker to make a host call to enc_untrusted_create_wait_queue that uses a pointer queue that relies on UntrustedLocalMemcpy, which fails to validate where the pointer is located. This allows an attacker to write memory values from within the enclave. IBM X-Force ID: 190289.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-17&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-4845&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-4845\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-4845&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/190289\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;XF&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/6253781\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;igniterealtime -- openfire&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Ignite Realtime Openfire 4.6.0 has create-bookmark.jsp users Stored XSS.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-12&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35201&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35201\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35201&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/49234\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;igniterealtime -- openfire&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Ignite Realtime Openfire 4.6.0 has create-bookmark.jsp groupchatJID Stored XSS.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-12&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35199&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35199\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35199&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/49233\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;igniterealtime -- openfire&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Ignite Realtime Openfire 4.6.0 has plugins/dbaccess/db-access.jsp sql Stored XSS.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-12&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35202&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35202\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35202&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/49235\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;linuxfoundation -- osquery&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;osquery is a SQL powered operating system instrumentation, monitoring, and analytics framework. In osquery before version 4.6.0, by using sqlite's ATTACH verb, someone with administrative access to osquery can cause reads and writes to arbitrary sqlite databases on disk. This _does_ allow arbitrary files to be created, but they will be sqlite databases. It does not appear to allow existing non-sqlite files to be overwritten. This has been patched in osquery 4.6.0. There are several mitigating factors and possible workarounds. In some deployments, the people with access to these interfaces may be considered administrators. In some deployments, configuration is managed by a central tool. This tool can filter for the `ATTACH` keyword. osquery can be run as non-root user. Because this also limits the desired access levels, this requires deployment specific testing and configuration.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-16&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26273&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.6&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26273\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26273&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/osquery/osquery/commit/c3f9a3dae22d43ed3b4f6a403cbf89da4cba7c3c\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/osquery/osquery/releases/tag/4.6.0\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/osquery/osquery/security/advisories/GHSA-4g56-2482-x7q8\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/swisskyrepo/PayloadsAllTheThings/blob/master/SQL%20Injection/SQLite%20Injection.md#remote-command-execution-using-sqlite-command---load_extension\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;logmein -- lastpass&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in the LogMein LastPass Password Manager (aka com.lastpass.ilastpass) app 4.8.11.2403 for iOS. The password authentication for unlocking can be bypassed by forcing the authentication result to be true through runtime manipulation. In other words, an attacker could authenticate with an arbitrary password. NOTE: the vendor has indicated that this is not an attack of interest within the context of their threat model, which excludes jailbroken devices.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-12&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35208&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35208\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35208&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/evilblazer/LastPassVulnerabilities\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://youtu.be/63PfHVSr8iw\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;logmein -- lastpass&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in the LogMein LastPass Password Manager (aka com.lastpass.ilastpass) app 4.8.11.2403 for iOS. The PIN authentication for unlocking can be bypassed by forcing the authentication result to be true through runtime manipulation. In other words, an attacker could authenticate with an arbitrary PIN. NOTE: the vendor has indicated that this is not an attack of interest within the context of their threat model, which excludes jailbroken devices.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-12&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35207&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35207\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35207&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/evilblazer/LastPassVulnerabilities\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://youtu.be/C5j7drIylsQ\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mitel -- micollab&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The NuPoint Messenger Portal of Mitel MiCollab before 9.2 could allow an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary scripts due to insufficient input validation, aka XSS. width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-28214&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28214\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28214&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-04\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.se.com/ww/en/download/document/SEVD-2020-315-05/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;siemens -- logo\\!_8_bm_firmware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A vulnerability has been identified in LOGO! 8 BM (incl. SIPLUS variants) (All versions &amp;lt; V8.3). The firmware update of affected devices contains the private RSA key that is used as a basis for encryption of communication with the device.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-14&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25233&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25233\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25233&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-480824.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;siemens -- logo\\!_8_bm_firmware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A vulnerability has been identified in LOGO! 8 BM (incl. SIPLUS variants) (All versions &amp;lt; V8.3), LOGO! Soft Comfort (All versions &amp;lt; V8.3). The LOGO! program files generated and used by the affected components offer the possibility to save user-defined functions (UDF) in a password protected way. This protection is implemented in the software that displays the information. An attacker could reverse engineer the UDFs directly from stored program files.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-14&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25234&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.6&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25234\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25234&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-480824.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;siemens -- logo\\!_8_bm_firmware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A vulnerability has been identified in LOGO! 8 BM (incl. SIPLUS variants) (All versions &amp;lt; V8.3), LOGO! Soft Comfort (All versions &amp;lt; V8.3). The encryption of program data for the affected devices uses a static key. An attacker could use this key to extract confidential information from protected program files.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-14&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25231&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25231\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25231&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-480824.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;siemens -- xhq&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A vulnerability has been identified in XHQ (All Versions &amp;lt; 6.1). The web interface could allow injections that could lead to XSS attacks if unsuspecting users are tricked into accessing a malicious link.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-14&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2019-19285&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;3.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2019-19285\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2019-19285&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-712690.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;siemens -- xhq&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A vulnerability has been identified in XHQ (All Versions &amp;lt; 6.1). The web interface could allow Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks if an attacker is able to modify content of particular web pages, causing the application to behave in unexpected ways for legitimate users.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-14&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;
