width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-14206&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-14206\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-14206&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/divebook/#developers\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.hooperlabs.xyz/disclosures/divebook.php\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;divebook_project -- divebook&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The DiveBook plugin 1.1.4 for WordPress is prone to improper access control in the Log Dive form because it fails to perform authorization checks. An attacker may leverage this issue to manipulate the integrity of dive logs.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-14205&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-14205\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-14205&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/divebook/#developers\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.hooperlabs.xyz/disclosures/divebook.php\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;divebook_project -- divebook&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The DiveBook plugin 1.1.4 for WordPress was prone to a SQL injection within divelog.php, allowing unauthenticated users to retrieve data from the database via the divelog.php filter_diver parameter.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-14207&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-14207\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-14207&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/divebook/#developers\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.hooperlabs.xyz/disclosures/divebook.php\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;getkirby -- kirby&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Kirby is a CMS. In Kirby CMS (getkirby/cms) before version 3.4.5, and Kirby Panel before version 2.5.14 , an editor with full access to the Kirby Panel can upload a PHP .phar file and execute it on the server. This vulnerability is critical if you might have potential attackers in your group of authenticated Panel users, as they can gain access to the server with such a Phar file. Visitors without Panel access *cannot* use this attack vector. The problem has been patched in Kirby 2.5.14 and Kirby 3.4.5. Please update to one of these or a later version to fix the vulnerability. Note: Kirby 2 reaches end of life on December 31, 2020. We therefore recommend to upgrade your Kirby 2 sites to Kirby 3. If you cannot upgrade, we still recommend to update to Kirby 2.5.14.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26255&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26255\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26255&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/getkirby/kirby/commit/db8f371b13036861c9cc5ba3e85e27f73fce5e09\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/getkirby/kirby/releases/tag/3.4.5\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/getkirby/kirby/security/advisories/GHSA-g3h8-cg9x-47qw\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/getkirby-v2/panel/commit/5a569d4e3ddaea2b6628d7ec1472a3e8bc410881\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://packagist.org/packages/getkirby/cms\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://packagist.org/packages/getkirby/panel\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;getkirby -- kirby&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Kirby is a CMS. In Kirby CMS (getkirby/cms) before version 3.3.6, and Kirby Panel before version 2.5.14 there is a vulnerability in which the admin panel may be accessed if hosted on a .dev domain. In order to protect new installations on public servers that don't have an admin account for the Panel yet, we block account registration there by default. This is a security feature, which we implemented years ago in Kirby 2. It helps to avoid that you forget registering your first admin account on a public server. In this case  without our security block  someone else might theoretically be able to find your site, find out it's running on Kirby, find the Panel and then register the account first. It's an unlikely situation, but it's still a certain risk. To be able to register the first Panel account on a public server, you have to enforce the installer via a config setting. This helps to push all users to the best practice of registering your first Panel account on your local machine and upload it together with the rest of the site. This installation block implementation in Kirby versions before 3.3.6 still assumed that .dev domains are local domains, which is no longer true. In the meantime, those domains became publicly available. This means that our installation block is no longer working as expected if you use a .dev domain for your Kirby site. Additionally the local installation check may also fail if your site is behind a reverse proxy. You are only affected if you use a .dev domain or your site is behind a reverse proxy and you have not yet registered your first Panel account on the public server and someone finds your site and tries to login at `yourdomain.dev/panel` before you register your first account. You are not affected if you have already created one or multiple Panel accounts (no matter if on a .dev domain or behind a reverse proxy). The problem has been patched in Kirby 3.3.6. Please upgrade to this or a later version to fix the vulnerability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26253&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26253\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26253&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/getkirby/kirby/releases/tag/3.3.6\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/getkirby/kirby/security/advisories/GHSA-2ccx-2gf3-8xvv\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/getkirby-v2/panel/commit/7f9ac1876bacb89fd8f142f5e561a02ebb725baa\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://packagist.org/packages/getkirby/cms\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://packagist.org/packages/getkirby/panel\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gnu -- binutils&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A use after free issue exists in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd) in GNU Binutils 2.34 in bfd_hash_lookup, as demonstrated in nm-new, that can cause a denial of service via a crafted file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-16592&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-16592\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-16592&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25823\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=7ecb51549ab1ec22aba5aaf34b70323cf0b8509a\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gnu -- binutils&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A Null Pointer Dereference vulnerability exists in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.34, in scan_unit_for_symbols, as demonstrated in addr2line, that can cause a denial of service via a crafted file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-16593&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-16593\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-16593&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25827\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=aec72fda3b320c36eb99fc1c4cf95b10fc026729\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gnu -- binutils&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A Null Pointer Dereference vulnerability exists in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.34, in debug_get_real_type, as demonstrated in objdump, that can cause a denial of service via a crafted file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-16598&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-16598\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-16598&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25840\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=ca3f923f82a079dcf441419f4a50a50f8b4b33c2\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gnu -- binutils&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A Null Pointer Dereference vulnerability exists in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.34, in _bfd_elf_get_symbol_version_string, as demonstrated in nm-new, that can cause a denial of service via a crafted file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-16599&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-16599\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-16599&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25842\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=8d55d10ac0d112c586eaceb92e75bd9b80aadcc4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gnu -- binutils&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A double free vulnerability exists in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) (aka libbrd) in GNU Binutils 2.34 in the process_symbol_table, as demonstrated in readelf, via a crafted file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-16590&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-16590\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-16590&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25821\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=c98a4545dc7bf2bcaf1de539c4eb84784680eaa4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gnu -- binutils&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A Denial of Service vulnerability exists in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) in GNU Binutils 2.34 due to an invalid read in process_symbol_table, as demonstrated in readeif.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-16591&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-16591\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-16591&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25822\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=001890e1f9269697f7e0212430a51479271bdab2\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gnu -- glibc&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;sysdeps/i386/ldbl2mpn.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23 on x86 targets has a stack-based buffer overflow if the input to any of the printf family of functions is an 80-bit long double with a non-canonical bit pattern, as seen when passing a \\x00\\x04\\x00\\x00\\x00\\x00\\x00\\x00\\x00\\x04 value to sprintf.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-06&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29573&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29573\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29573&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26649\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/pipermail/libc-alpha/2020-September/117779.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;gnu -- glibc&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.30 to 2.32, when converting UCS4 text containing an irreversible character, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29562&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29562\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29562&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26923\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;huawei -- honor_20_pro_firmware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in several Huawei products. The system does not sufficiently validate certain configuration parameter which is passed from user that would cause buffer overflow. The attacker should trick the user into installing and running a malicious application with a high privilege, successful exploit may cause code execution. Affected product include Huawei HONOR 20 PRO, Mate 20, Mate 20 Pro, Mate 20 X, P30, P30 Pro, Hima-L29C, Laya-AL00EP, Princeton-AL10B, Tony-AL00B, Yale-L61A, Yale-TL00B and YaleP-AL10B.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-07&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-9247&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-9247\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-9247&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.huawei.com/en/psirt/security-advisories/huawei-sa-20200729-03-smartphone-en\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;ibm -- sterling_b2b_integrator&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;IBM Sterling B2B Integrator Standard Edition 5.2.0.0 through 5.2.6.5 and 6.0.0.0 through 6.0.3.1 discloses sensitive information to an authenticated user from the dashboard UI which could be used in further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 172753.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2019-4738&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2019-4738\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2019-4738&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/172753\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;XF&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/6380390\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/gem-private.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of values outside the range of type `unsigned char` or division by zero. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27773&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27773\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27773&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1898295\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In the CropImage() and CropImageToTiles() routines of MagickCore/transform.c, rounding calculations performed on unconstrained pixel offsets was causing undefined behavior in the form of integer overflow and out-of-range values as reported by UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer. Such issues could cause a negative impact to application availability or other problems related to undefined behavior, in cases where ImageMagick processes untrusted input data. The upstream patch introduces functionality to constrain the pixel offsets and prevent these issues. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25675&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25675\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25675&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891933\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Due to a missing check for 0 value of `replace_extent`, it is possible for offset `p` to overflow in SubstituteString(), causing potential impact to application availability. This could be triggered by a crafted input file that is processed by ImageMagick. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.8-68.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27770&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27770\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27770&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894691\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In CatromWeights(), MeshInterpolate(), InterpolatePixelChannel(), InterpolatePixelChannels(), and InterpolatePixelInfo(), which are all functions in /MagickCore/pixel.c, there were multiple unconstrained pixel offset calculations which were being used with the floor() function. These calculations produced undefined behavior in the form of out-of-range and integer overflows, as identified by UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer. These instances of undefined behavior could be triggered by an attacker who is able to supply a crafted input file to be processed by ImageMagick. These issues could impact application availability or potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25676&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25676\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25676&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891934\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/quantum.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of values outside the range of types `float` and `unsigned char`. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27767&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27767\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27767&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894687\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/segment.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of math division by zero. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27765&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27765\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27765&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894684\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in coders/txt.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of values outside the range of type `unsigned long long`. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.8-68.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27758&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27758\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27758&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894236\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;WriteOnePNGImage() from coders/png.c (the PNG coder) has a for loop with an improper exit condition that can allow an out-of-bounds READ via heap-buffer-overflow. This occurs because it is possible for the colormap to have less than 256 valid values but the loop condition will loop 256 times, attempting to pass invalid colormap data to the event logger. The patch replaces the hardcoded 256 value with a call to MagickMin() to ensure the proper value is used. This could impact application availability when a specially crafted input file is processed by ImageMagick. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.8-68.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25674&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25674\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25674&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891928\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/colorspace-private.h and MagickCore/quantum.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of values outside the range of type `unsigned char` and math division by zero. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.8-68.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27750&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27750\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27750&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891984\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/quantum-export.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of values outside the range of type `unsigned long long` as well as a shift exponent that is too large for 64-bit type. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27751&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27751\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27751&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891994\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;There are several memory leaks in the MIFF coder in /coders/miff.c due to improper image depth values, which can be triggered by a specially crafted input file. These leaks could potentially lead to an impact to application availability or cause a denial of service. It was originally reported that the issues were in `AcquireMagickMemory()` because that is where LeakSanitizer detected the leaks, but the patch resolves issues in the MIFF coder, which incorrectly handles data being passed to `AcquireMagickMemory()`. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27753&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27753\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27753&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894229\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In IntensityCompare() of /magick/quantize.c, there are calls to PixelPacketIntensity() which could return overflowed values to the caller when ImageMagick processes a crafted input file. To mitigate this, the patch introduces and uses the ConstrainPixelIntensity() function, which forces the pixel intensities to be within the proper bounds in the event of an overflow. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 6.9.10-69 and 7.0.8-69.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27754&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27754\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27754&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894231\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;in SetImageExtent() of /MagickCore/image.c, an incorrect image depth size can cause a memory leak because the code which checks for the proper image depth size does not reset the size in the event there is an invalid size. The patch resets the depth to a proper size before throwing an exception. The memory leak can be triggered by a crafted input file that is processed by ImageMagick and could cause an impact to application reliability, such as denial of service. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27755&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27755\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27755&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894232\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In ParseMetaGeometry() of MagickCore/geometry.c, image height and width calculations can lead to divide-by-zero conditions which also lead to undefined behavior. This flaw can be triggered by a crafted input file processed by ImageMagick and could impact application availability. The patch uses multiplication in addition to the function `PerceptibleReciprocal()` in order to prevent such divide-by-zero conditions. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27756&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27756\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27756&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894233\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In RestoreMSCWarning() of /coders/pdf.c there are several areas where calls to GetPixelIndex() could result in values outside the range of representable for the unsigned char type. The patch casts the return value of GetPixelIndex() to ssize_t type to avoid this bug. This undefined behavior could be triggered when ImageMagick processes a crafted pdf file. Red Hat Product Security marked this as Low severity because although it could potentially lead to an impact to application availability, no specific impact was demonstrated in this case. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27771&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27771\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27771&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1898290\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in coders/bmp.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of values outside the range of type `unsigned int`. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27772&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27772\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27772&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1898291\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;TIFFGetProfiles() in /coders/tiff.c calls strstr() which causes a large out-of-bounds read when it searches for `\"dc:format=\\\"image/dng\\\"` within `profile` due to improper string handling, when a crafted input file is provided to ImageMagick. The patch uses a StringInfo type instead of a raw C string to remedy this. This could cause an impact to availability of the application. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25667&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25667\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25667&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891613\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/statistic.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of values outside the range of type `unsigned long`. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.8-69.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27766&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27766\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27766&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894686\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/statistic.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of values outside the range of type unsigned long. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27776&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27776\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27776&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1898304\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/quantum.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of values outside the range of type unsigned char. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27775&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27775\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27775&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1898300\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In WriteOnePNGImage() of the PNG coder at coders/png.c, an improper call to AcquireVirtualMemory() and memset() allows for an out-of-bounds write later when PopShortPixel() from MagickCore/quantum-private.h is called. The patch fixes the calls by adding 256 to rowbytes. An attacker who is able to supply a specially crafted image could affect availability with a low impact to data integrity. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 6.9.10-68 and 7.0.8-68.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25664&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25664\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25664&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891605\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/statistic.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of a too large shift for 64-bit type `ssize_t`. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially cause other problems related to undefined behavior. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27774&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27774\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27774&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1898296\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A floating point math calculation in ScaleAnyToQuantum() of /MagickCore/quantum-private.h could lead to undefined behavior in the form of a value outside the range of type unsigned long long. The flaw could be triggered by a crafted input file under certain conditions when it is processed by ImageMagick. Red Hat Product Security marked this as Low because although it could potentially lead to an impact to application availability, no specific impact was shown in this case. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.8-68.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27757&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27757\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27757&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894234\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A call to ConformPixelInfo() in the SetImageAlphaChannel() routine of /MagickCore/channel.c caused a subsequent heap-use-after-free or heap-buffer-overflow READ when GetPixelRed() or GetPixelBlue() was called. This could occur if an attacker is able to submit a malicious image file to be processed by ImageMagick and could lead to denial of service. It likely would not lead to anything further because the memory is used as pixel data and not e.g. a function pointer. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25663&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25663\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25663&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891601\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/1723\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/1723#issuecomment-718275153\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The PALM image coder at coders/palm.c makes an improper call to AcquireQuantumMemory() in routine WritePALMImage() because it needs to be offset by 256. This can cause a out-of-bounds read later on in the routine. The patch adds 256 to bytes_per_row in the call to AcquireQuantumMemory(). This could cause impact to reliability. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.8-68.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25665&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25665\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25665&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891606\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;There are 4 places in HistogramCompare() in MagickCore/histogram.c where an integer overflow is possible during simple math calculations. This occurs in the rgb values and `count` value for a color. The patch uses casts to `ssize_t` type for these calculations, instead of `int`. This flaw could impact application reliability in the event that ImageMagick processes a crafted input file. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-25666&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25666\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25666&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1891612\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;imagemagick -- imagemagick&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/quantum-private.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger a heap buffer overflow. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially lead to an impact to data integrity as well. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27752&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;5.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27752\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27752&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894226\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;infolific -- ultimate_category_excluder&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The ultimate-category-excluder plugin before 1.2 for WordPress allows ultimate-category-excluder.php CSRF.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-35135&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.8&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35135\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35135&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://plugins.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/2434070\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/ultimate-category-excluder/#developers\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;inspur -- nf8480m5_firmware&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Inspur NF5266M5 through 3.21.2 and other server M5 devices allow remote code execution via administrator privileges. The Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) program of INSPUR server is weak in checking the firmware and lacks the signature verification mechanism, the attacker who obtains the administrator's rights can control the BMC by inserting malicious code into the firmware program and bypassing the current verification mechanism to upgrade the BMC.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-07&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26122&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26122\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26122&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://en.inspur.com/en/2487134/index.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://en.inspur.com/en/security_bulletins/security_advisory2/2543921/index.html\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;intland -- codebeamer_application_lifecycle_management&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in Intland codeBeamer ALM 10.x through 10.1.SP4. The ReqIF XML data, used by the codebeamer ALM application to import projects, is parsed by insecurely configured software components, which can be abused for XML External Entity Attacks.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-07&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26513&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26513\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26513&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://compass-security.com/fileadmin/Research/Advisories/2020-09_CSNC-2020-008_Intland_codeBeamer_ALM_XXE.txt\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://intland.com/codebeamer/application-lifecycle-management/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;jerryscript -- jerryscript&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In JerryScript 2.3.0, there is an out-of-bounds read in main_print_unhandled_exception in the main-utils.c file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-29657&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29657\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29657&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/jerryscript-project/jerryscript/issues/4244\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;kaspersky -- anti-ransomware_tool&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The installer of Kaspersky Anti-Ransomware Tool (KART) prior to KART 4.0 Patch C was vulnerable to a DLL hijacking attack that allowed an attacker to elevate privileges during installation process.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-04&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-28950&amp;amp;vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;6.9&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28950\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28950&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/192653\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.kaspersky.com/general/vulnerability.aspx?el=12430#290720\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;libpng -- pngcheck&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in the check_chunk_name() function of pngcheck-2.4.0. An attacker able to pass a malicious file to be processed by pngcheck could cause a temporary denial of service, posing a low risk to application availability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-08&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-27818&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27818\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27818&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-04d5e1ce26\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-23432b7b72\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-27b168926a\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-4349e95c4f\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2020-339db397ad\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2020-6c93c61069\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1902011\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;matrix -- synapse&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Matrix is an ecosystem for open federated Instant Messaging and VoIP. Synapse is a reference \"homeserver\" implementation of Matrix. A malicious or poorly-implemented homeserver can inject malformed events into a room by specifying a different room id in the path of a `/send_join`, `/send_leave`, `/invite` or `/exchange_third_party_invite` request. This can lead to a denial of service in which future events will not be correctly sent to other servers over federation. This affects any server which accepts federation requests from untrusted servers. The Matrix Synapse reference implementation before version 1.23.1 the implementation is vulnerable to this injection attack. Issue is fixed in version 1.23.1. As a workaround homeserver administrators could limit access to the federation API to trusted servers (for example via `federation_domain_whitelist`).&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm?version=2&amp;amp;name=CVE-2020-26257&amp;amp;vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:P\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"CVSS V2 Score\"&gt;4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-26257\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-26257&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/matrix-org/synapse/blob/develop/CHANGES.md#synapse-1231-2020-12-09\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/matrix-org/synapse/commit/3ce2f303f15f6ac3dc352298972dc6e04d9b7a8b\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/matrix-org/synapse/pull/8776\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/matrix-org/synapse/security/advisories/GHSA-hxmp-pqch-c8mm\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mcafee -- virusscan_enterprise&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource vulnerability in McAfee VirusScan Enterprise (VSE) prior to 8.8 Patch 16 allows local administrators to bypass local security protection through VSE not correctly integrating with Windows Defender Application Control via careful manipulation of the Code Integrity checks.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;
