width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35200\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35200&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://discourse.igniterealtime.org/t/openfire-4-6-0-has-reflective-xss-vulnerabilities/89296\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;ini -- ini&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;This affects the package ini before 1.3.6. If an attacker submits a malicious INI file to an application that parses it with ini.parse, they will pollute the prototype on the application. This can be exploited further depending on the context.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-7788\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-7788&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/npm/ini/commit/56d2805e07ccd94e2ba0984ac9240ff02d44b6f1\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-INI-1048974\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;jasper -- jpc_encoder&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;There's a flaw in jasper's jpc encoder in versions prior to 2.0.23. Crafted input provided to jasper by an attacker could cause an arbitrary out-of-bounds write. This could potentially affect data confidentiality, integrity, or application availability.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27828\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27828&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1905201\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/jasper-software/jasper/issues/252\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;kapacitor -- &amp;nbsp;kapacitor&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Versions of the Official kapacitor Docker images through 1.5.0-alpine contain a blank password for the root user. Systems deployed using affected versions of the kapacitor container may allow a remote attacker to achieve root access with a blank password.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29589\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29589&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5021\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-29389\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/donghyunlee00/CVE/blob/main/CVE-2020-29589\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/influxdata/influxdata-docker\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://hub.docker.com/_/kapacitor\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;lan_atmservice_m3_atm_monitoring_system&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In Lan ATMService M3 ATM Monitoring System 6.1.0, a remote attacker able to use a default cookie value, such as PHPSESSID=LANIT-IMANAGER, can achieve control over the system because of Insufficient Session Expiration.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29667\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29667&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://lanatmservice.ru/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/jet-pentest/CVE-2020-29667\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;lan_atmservice_m3_atm_monitoring_system&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In Lan ATMService M3 ATM Monitoring System 6.1.0, due to a directory-listing vulnerability, a remote attacker can view log files, located in /websocket/logs/, that contain a user's cookie values and the predefined developer's cookie value.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29666\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29666&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"http://lanatmservice.ru/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/jet-pentest/CVE-2020-29666\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;linux -- linux_kernel&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A use-after-free flaw was found in kernel/trace/ring_buffer.c in Linux kernel (5.10-rc1). There was a race problem in trace_open and resize of cpu buffer running in parallel on different cpus, may cause a denial of service problem (DOS). This flaw could even allow a local attacker with special user privilege to a kernel information leak threat.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27825\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27825&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1905155\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;linux -- linux_kernel&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A flaw was found in the Linux kernels implementation of MIDI (kernel 5.7-rc6), where an attacker with a local account and the permissions to issue an ioctl commands to midi devices, could trigger a use-after-free. A write to this specific memory while freed and before use could cause the flow of execution to change and possibly allow for memory corruption or privilege escalation.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27786\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27786&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1900933\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=c1f6e3c818dd734c30f6a7eeebf232ba2cf3181d\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;macrium_reflect -- macrium_reflect&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Macrium Reflect includes an OpenSSL component that specifies an OPENSSLDIR variable as C:\\openssl\\. Macrium Reflect contains a privileged service that uses this OpenSSL component. Because unprivileged Windows users can create subdirectories off of the system root, a user can create the appropriate path to a specially-crafted openssl.cnf file to achieve arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-10143\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-10143&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/760767\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mcafee -- database_security_server_and_sensor&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm vulnerability in McAfee Database Security Server and Sensor prior to 4.8.0 in the form of a SHA1 signed certificate that would allow an attacker on the same local network to potentially intercept communication between the Server and Sensors.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-7339\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-7339&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&amp;amp;id=SB10340\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;micro_focus -- filr&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information vulnerability in Micro Focus Filr product. Affecting all 3.x and 4.x versions. The vulnerability could be exploited to disclose unauthorized sensitive information.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25838\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25838&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://softwaresupport.softwaregrp.com/doc/KM03767186\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;microsoft -- edge_(edgehtml-based)_and_chakracore&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;, aka 'Chakra Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability'.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17131\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17131&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-17131\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mout -- mout&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;This affects all versions of package mout. The deepFillIn function can be used to 'fill missing properties recursively', while the deepMixIn 'mixes objects into the target object, recursively mixing existing child objects as well'. In both cases, the key used to access the target object recursively is not checked, leading to a Prototype Pollution.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-7792\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-7792&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/mout/mout/blob/master/src/object/deepFillIn.js\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/mout/mout/blob/master/src/object/deepMixIn.js\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARS-1050374\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARSNPM-1050373\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-MOUT-1014544\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;mquery -- mquery&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;lib/utils.js in mquery before 3.2.3 allows a pollution attack because a special property (e.g., __proto__) can be copied during a merge or clone operation.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-35149\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-35149&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/aheckmann/mquery/commit/792e69fd0a7281a0300be5cade5a6d7c1d468ad4\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;national_instruments_corp -- compactrio&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Incorrect permissions are set by default for an API entry-point of a specific service, allowing a non-authenticated user to trigger a function that could reboot the CompactRIO (Driver versions prior to 20.5) remotely.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25191\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25191&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-338-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;netflix -- spinnaker&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Nolan Ray from Apple Information Security identified a security vulnerability in Spinnaker, all versions prior to version 1.23.4, 1.22.4 or 1.21.5. The vulnerability exists within the handling of SpEL expressions that allows an attacker to read and write arbitrary files within the orca container via authenticated HTTP POST requests.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-9301\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-9301&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/Netflix/security-bulletins/blob/master/advisories/nflx-2020-006.md\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;nginx -- controller_agent&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;In versions 3.0.0-3.9.0, 2.0.0-2.9.0, and 1.0.1, the NGINX Controller Agent does not use absolute paths when calling system utilities.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-27730\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-27730&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K43530108\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;node-notifier -- node-notifier&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;This affects the package node-notifier before 9.0.0. It allows an attacker to run arbitrary commands on Linux machines due to the options params not being sanitised when being passed an array.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-7789\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-7789&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/mikaelbr/node-notifier/blob/master/lib/utils.js%23L303\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARSNPM-1050371\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-NODENOTIFIER-1035794\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;nut -- nut&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in the DNS implementation in Ethernut in Nut/OS 5.1. There is no check on whether a domain name has '\\0' termination. This may lead to successful Denial-of-Service, and possibly Remote Code Execution.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25107\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25107&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;nut -- nut&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in the DNS implementation in Ethernut in Nut/OS 5.1. The DNS response data length is not checked (it can be set to an arbitrary value from a packet). This may lead to successful Denial-of-Service, and possibly Remote Code Execution.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25108\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25108&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;nut -- nut&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in the DNS implementation in Ethernut in Nut/OS 5.1. The length byte of a domain name in a DNS query/response is not checked, and is used for internal memory operations. This may lead to successful Denial-of-Service, and possibly Remote Code Execution.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25110\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25110&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;nut -- nut&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in the DNS implementation in Ethernut in Nut/OS 5.1. The number of DNS queries/responses (set in a DNS header) is not checked against the data present. This may lead to successful Denial-of-Service, and possibly Remote Code Execution.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-25109\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-25109&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;opencart -- opencart_cms&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) in CART option in OpenCart Ltd. Opencart CMS 3.0.3.6 allows attacker to add cart items via Add to cart.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-28838\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-28838&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/49228\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.opencart.com/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;palo_alto_networks -- cortex_xdr_agent&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A local privilege escalation vulnerability exists in Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR Agent on the Windows platform that allows an authenticated local Windows user to execute programs with SYSTEM privileges. This requires the user to have the privilege to create files in the Windows root directory. This issue impacts: All versions of Cortex XDR Agent 7.1 with content update 149 and earlier versions; All versions of Cortex XDR Agent 7.2 with content update 149 and earlier versions.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-2049\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-2049&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2020-2049\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;phpoffice -- phpspreadsheet&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;This affects the package phpoffice/phpspreadsheet from 0.0.0. The library is vulnerable to XSS when creating an html output from an excel file by adding a comment on any cell. The root cause of this issue is within the HTML writer where user comments are concatenated as part of link and this is returned as HTML. A fix for this issue is available on commit 0ed5b800be2136bcb8fa9c1bdf59abc957a98845/master branch.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-7776\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-7776&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/PHPOffice/PhpSpreadsheet/blob/master/src/PhpSpreadsheet/Writer/Html.php%23L1792\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/PHPOffice/PhpSpreadsheet/commit/0ed5b800be2136bcb8fa9c1bdf59abc957a98845\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PHP-PHPOFFICEPHPSPREADSHEET-1048856\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;phpshe -- phpshe&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;PHPSHE 1.7 has SQL injection via the admin.php?mod=user&amp;amp;userlevel_id=1 userlevel_id[] parameter.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-19165\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-19165&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/Mint60/PHP/issues/1\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP 1.7.0. The code for creating an ICMPv6 echo replies doesn't check whether the ICMPv6 echo request packet's size is shorter than 8 bytes. If the size of the incoming ICMPv6 request packet is shorter than this, the operation that calculates the size of the ICMPv6 echo replies has an integer wrap around, leading to memory corruption and, eventually, Denial-of-Service in pico_icmp6_send_echoreply_not_frag in pico_icmp6.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17443\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17443&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP 1.7.0. The code for processing the IPv6 headers does not validate whether the IPv6 payload length field is equal to the actual size of the payload, which leads to an Out-of-Bounds read during the ICMPv6 checksum calculation, resulting in either Denial-of-Service or Information Disclosure. This affects pico_ipv6_extension_headers and pico_checksum_adder (in pico_ipv6.c and pico_frame.c).&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17441\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17441&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP 1.7.0. The code for processing the IPv6 destination options does not check for a valid length of the destination options header. This results in an Out-of-Bounds Read, and, depending on the memory protection mechanism, this may result in Denial-of-Service in pico_ipv6_process_destopt() in pico_ipv6.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17445\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17445&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP 1.7.0. The routine for processing the next header field (and deducing whether the IPv6 extension headers are valid) doesn't check whether the header extension length field would overflow. Therefore, if it wraps around to zero, iterating through the extension headers will not increment the current data pointer. This leads to an infinite loop and Denial-of-Service in pico_ipv6_check_headers_sequence() in pico_ipv6.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17444\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17444&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP 1.7.0. The code for parsing the hop-by-hop IPv6 extension headers does not validate the bounds of the extension header length value, which may result in Integer Wraparound. Therefore, a crafted extension header length value may cause Denial-of-Service because it affects the loop in which the extension headers are parsed in pico_ipv6_process_hopbyhop() in pico_ipv6.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-17442\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-17442&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp_and_picotcp-ng&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP and picoTCP-NG through 1.7.0. When an unsupported TCP option with zero length is provided in an incoming TCP packet, it is possible to cause a Denial-of-Service by achieving an infinite loop in the code that parses TCP options, aka tcp_parse_options() in pico_tcp.c.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24337\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24337&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp_and_picotcp-ng&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP and picoTCP-NG through 1.7.0. The DNS domain name record decompression functionality in pico_dns_decompress_name() in pico_dns_common.c does not validate the compression pointer offset values with respect to the actual data present in a DNS response packet, causing out-of-bounds reads that lead to Denial-of-Service.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24339\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24339&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp_and_picotcp-ng&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP and picoTCP-NG through 1.7.0. The code that processes DNS responses in pico_mdns_handle_data_as_answers_generic() in pico_mdns.c does not check whether the number of answers/responses specified in a DNS packet header corresponds to the response data available in the packet, leading to an out-of-bounds read, invalid pointer dereference, and Denial-of-Service.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24340\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24340&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp_and_picotcp-ng&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP through 1.7.0. The DNS domain name record decompression functionality in pico_dns_decompress_name() in pico_dns_common.c does not validate the compression pointer offset values with respect to the actual data present in a DNS response packet, causing out-of-bounds writes that lead to Denial-of-Service and Remote Code Execution.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24338\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24338&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;picotcp -- picotcp_and_picotcp-ng&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An issue was discovered in picoTCP and picoTCP-NG through 1.7.0. The TCP input data processing function in pico_tcp.c does not validate the length of incoming TCP packets, which leads to an out-of-bounds read when assembling received packets into a data segment, eventually causing Denial-of-Service or an information leak.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-24341\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-24341&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics/advisories/icsa-20-343-01\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/815128\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;pixar -- openusd&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;An out of bounds memory corruption vulnerability exists in the way Pixar OpenUSD 20.05 reconstructs paths from binary USD files. A specially crafted malformed file can trigger an out of bounds memory modification which can result in remote code execution. To trigger this vulnerability, victim needs to access an attacker-provided malformed file.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-13520\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-13520&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1120\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;qnap -- qts_and _quts_hero&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;This command injection vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands in a compromised application. QNAP have already fixed this vulnerability in the following versions of QTS and QuTS hero. QuTS hero h4.5.1.1472 build 20201031 and later QTS 4.5.1.1456 build 20201015 and later QTS 4.4.3.1354 build 20200702 and later&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-10&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2019-7198\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2019-7198&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-20-16\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;registry -- registry&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Versions of the Official registry Docker images through 2.7.0 contain a blank password for the root user. Systems deployed using affected versions of the registry container may allow a remote attacker to achieve root access with a blank password.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-29591\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-29591&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-5021\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-29389\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/docker/distribution-library-image\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://github.com/donghyunlee00/CVE/blob/main/CVE-2020-29591\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://hub.docker.com/_/registry\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;sap -- netweaver_as_java&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;Process Integration Monitoring of SAP NetWeaver AS JAVA, versions - 7.31, 7.40, 7.50, allows an attacker to upload any file (including script files) without proper file format validation, leading to Unrestricted File Upload.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-09&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-7560\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-7560&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.se.com/ww/en/download/document/SEVD-2020-343-01/\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CONFIRM&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;schneider_electric -- ecostruxure_geo_scada_expert_2019&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;A CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials vulnerability exists in EcoStruxure Geo SCADA Expert 2019 (Original release and Monthly Updates to September 2020, from 81.7268.1 to 81.7578.1) and EcoStruxure Geo SCADA Expert 2020 (Original release and Monthly Updates to September 2020, from 83.7551.1 to 83.7578.1), that could cause exposure of credentials to server-side users when web users are logged in to Virtual ViewX.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; Modicon Premium (see security notifications for affected versions), that could cause denial of service when a specially crafted Read Physical Memory request over Modbus is sent to the controller.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to establish an interactive channel, effectively taking control of the target system. This vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker with authenticated access to the Orchestrator UI or EdgeConnect UI. This affects all current ECOS versions: 8.1.9.15, 8.3.0.8, 8.3.1.2, 8.3.2.0, 9.0.2.0, and 9.1.0.0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center; width: 5%;\"&gt;not yet calculated&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td&gt;&lt;a href=\"https://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2020-12148\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;CVE-2020-12148&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;a href=\"https://www.silver-peak.com/support/user-documentation/security-advisories\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;MISC&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t&lt;/tr&gt;\n\t\t&lt;tr&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td class=\"vendor-product\" scope=\"row\" style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;silver_peak -- ecos&lt;br /&gt;\n\t\t\t&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: left;\"&gt;The configuration backup/restore function in Silver Peak Unity ECOSTM (ECOS) appliance software was found to directly incorporate the user-controlled config filename in a subsequent shell command, allowing an attacker to manipulate the resulting command by injecting valid OS command input. This vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker with authenticated access to the Orchestrator UI or EdgeConnect UI. This affects ll current ECOS versions: 8.1.9.15, 8.3.0.8, 8.3.1.2, 8.3.2.0, 9.0.2.0, and 9.1.0.0.&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;\"&gt;2020-12-11&lt;/td&gt;\n\t\t\t&lt;td style=\"text-align: center;
